page.title: 12BLYTH HISTORY. (1)
page.content: Blyth is a most beautiful and fascinating place in North Nottinghamshire, situated just off the A1. The history goes back to prehistoric times, and Blyth is mentioned in the original Domesday book. In 1088 it was part of the manor of Tickhill. The priory is the second largest in Nottinghamshire. For many centuries, it was one of the most important towns in the county, and was endowed with fairs, markets and the famous tournament field. Its situation on a great highway led to many coaching inns being built; one of them, the Angel, has been there for at least 760 years; another was a Post House.
